00028 /* Includes ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00029 #include "ht32f5xxxx_i2s.h"
00030 
00031 /** @addtogroup HT32F5xxxx_Peripheral_Driver HT32F5xxxx Peripheral Driver
00032   * @{

00036   * @brief I2S driver modules

00041 /* Private constants ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00042 /** @defgroup I2S_Private_Define I2S private definitions
00043   * @{
00044   */
00045 #define I2S_EN          (1UL)
00046 #define MCLK_OP_EN      (1UL << 9)
00047 #define TX_MUTE_EN      (1UL << 12)
00048 #define CLK_DIV_EN      (1UL << 15)
00049 #define BCLK_INV_EN     (1UL << 18)
00050 #define MCLK_INV_EN     (1UL << 19)
00051 
00052 #define I2S_SLAVE       (1UL << 3)
00053 /**
00054   * @}
00055   */
00056 
00057 
00058 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00059 /** @defgroup I2S_Exported_Functions I2S exported functions
00060   * @{
00061   */
00062 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00063  * @brief Deinitialize the I2S peripheral registers to their default reset values.
00064  * @retval None
00065  ************************************************************************************************************/
00066 void I2S_DeInit(void)
00067 {
00068   RSTCU_PeripReset_TypeDef RSTCUReset = {{0}};
00069 
00070   RSTCUReset.Bit.I2S = 1;
00071   RSTCU_PeripReset(RSTCUReset, ENABLE);
00072 }
00073 
00074 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00075  * @brief Initialize the I2S peripheral according to the specified parameters in the I2S_InitStruct.
00076  * @param I2S_InitStruct: pointer to a I2S_InitTypeDef structure.
00077  * @retval None
00078  ************************************************************************************************************/
00079 void I2S_Init(I2S_InitTypeDef* I2S_InitStruct)
00080 {
00081   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00082   Assert_Param(IS_I2S_MODE(I2S_InitStruct->I2S_Mode));
00083   Assert_Param(IS_I2S_FORMAT(I2S_InitStruct->I2S_Format));
00084   Assert_Param(IS_I2S_WORD_WIDTH(I2S_InitStruct->I2S_WordWidth));
00085   Assert_Param(IS_I2S_MCLK_DIV(I2S_InitStruct->I2S_X_Div, I2S_InitStruct->I2S_Y_Div));
00086   Assert_Param(IS_I2S_BCLK_DIV(I2S_InitStruct->I2S_N_Div));
00087 
00088   HT_I2S->CR = I2S_InitStruct->I2S_Mode | I2S_InitStruct->I2S_Format | I2S_InitStruct->I2S_WordWidth;
00089 
00090   if (I2S_InitStruct->I2S_BclkInv == ENABLE)
00091   {
00092     HT_I2S->CR |= BCLK_INV_EN;
00093   }
00094 
00095   if (I2S_InitStruct->I2S_MclkInv == ENABLE)
00096   {
00097     HT_I2S->CR |= MCLK_INV_EN;
00098   }
00099 
00100   if ((I2S_InitStruct->I2S_Mode & I2S_SLAVE) == RESET)
00101   {
00102     HT_I2S->CDR = (I2S_InitStruct->I2S_N_Div << 16) | (I2S_InitStruct->I2S_X_Div << 8) |
00103                   (I2S_InitStruct->I2S_Y_Div);
00104     HT_I2S->CR |= CLK_DIV_EN;
00105     while (I2S_GetFlagStatus(I2S_FLAG_CLK_RDY) == RESET);
00106 
00107     if (I2S_InitStruct->I2S_MclkOut == ENABLE)
00108     {
00109       HT_I2S->CR |= MCLK_OP_EN;
00110     }
00111   }
00112 }
00113 
00114 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00115  * @brief Enable or Disable the I2S peripheral.
00116  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00117  * @retval None
00118  ************************************************************************************************************/
00119 void I2S_Cmd(ControlStatus NewState)
00120 {
00121   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00122   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00123 
00124   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00125   {
00126     HT_I2S->CR |= I2S_EN;
00127   }
00128   else
00129   {
00130     HT_I2S->CR &= ~I2S_EN;
00131   }
00132 }
00133 
00134 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00135  * @brief Enable or Disable the Tx mute for the I2S peripheral.
00136  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00137  * @retval None
00138  ************************************************************************************************************/
00139 void I2S_TxMuteCmd(ControlStatus NewState)
00140 {
00141   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00142   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00143 
00144   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00145   {
00146     HT_I2S->CR |= TX_MUTE_EN;
00147   }
00148   else
00149   {
00150     HT_I2S->CR &= ~TX_MUTE_EN;
00151   }
00152 }
00153 
00154 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00155  * @brief Enable or Disable the I2S PDMA interface.
00156  * @param I2S_PDMAREQ: specify the I2S PDMA transfer request to be enabled or disabled.
00157  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00158  *     @arg I2S_PDMAREQ_TX : Tx PDMA transfer request
00159  *     @arg I2S_PDMAREQ_RX : Rx PDMA transfer request
00160  * @param  NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00161  * @retval None
00162  ************************************************************************************************************/
00163 void I2S_PDMACmd(u32 I2S_PDMAREQ, ControlStatus NewState)
00164 {
00165   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00166   Assert_Param(IS_I2S_PDMA_REQ(I2S_PDMAREQ));
00167   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00168 
00169   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00170   {
00171     HT_I2S->CR |= I2S_PDMAREQ;
00172   }
00173   else
00174   {
00175     HT_I2S->CR &= I2S_PDMAREQ;
00176   }
00177 }
00178 
00179 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00180  * @brief Reset the specified I2S FIFO.
00181  * @param I2S_FIFO: specify the FIFO that is to be reset.
00182  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00183  *     @arg I2S_TX_FIFO : I2S Tx FIFO
00184  *     @arg I2S_RX_FIFO : I2S Rx FIFO
00185  * @retval None
00186  ************************************************************************************************************/
00187 void I2S_FIFOReset(u32 I2S_FIFO)
00188 {
00189   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00190   Assert_Param(IS_I2S_TWO_FIFO(I2S_FIFO));
00191 
00192   HT_I2S->FCR |= I2S_FIFO;
00193 }
00194 
00195 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00196  * @brief Set the trigger level of specified I2S FIFO.
00197  * @param I2S_FIFO: specify the FIFO that is to be set.
00198  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00199  *     @arg I2S_TX_FIFO : I2S Tx FIFO
00200  *     @arg I2S_RX_FIFO : I2S Rx FIFO
00201  * @param  I2S_FIFOLevel: Specify the FIFO trigger level.
00202  * @retval None
00203  ************************************************************************************************************/
00204 void I2S_FIFOTrigLevelConfig(u32 I2S_FIFO, u32 I2S_FIFOLevel)
00205 {
00206   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00207   Assert_Param(IS_I2S_TWO_FIFO(I2S_FIFO));
00208   Assert_Param(IS_I2S_FIFO_LEVEL(I2S_FIFOLevel));
00209 
00210   if (I2S_FIFO == I2S_TX_FIFO)
00211   {
00212     HT_I2S->FCR = ((HT_I2S->FCR & (~0x0000000F)) | I2S_FIFOLevel);
00213   }
00214   else
00215   {
00216     HT_I2S->FCR = ((HT_I2S->FCR & (~0x000000F0)) | (I2S_FIFOLevel << 4));
00217   }
00218 }
00219 
00220 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00221  * @brief Return the status of specified I2S FIFO.
00222  * @param I2S_FIFO: specify the FIFO that is to be checked.
00223  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00224  *     @arg I2S_TX_FIFO : I2S Tx FIFO
00225  *     @arg I2S_RX_FIFO : I2S Rx FIFO
00226  * @retval The number of data in specified I2S FIFO.
00227  ************************************************************************************************************/
00228 u8 I2S_GetFIFOStatus(u32 I2S_FIFO)
00229 {
00230   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00231   Assert_Param(IS_I2S_ONE_FIFO(I2S_FIFO));
00232 
00233   if (I2S_FIFO == I2S_TX_FIFO)
00234   {
00235     return (u8)((HT_I2S->SR >> 24) & 0x0F);
00236   }
00237   else
00238   {
00239     return (u8)(HT_I2S->SR >> 28);
00240   }
00241 }
00242 
00243 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00244  * @brief Enable or Disable the I2S interrupt.
00245  * @param I2S_Int: specify if the I2S interrupt source to be enabled or disabled.
00246  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00247  *     @arg I2S_INT_TXFIFO_TRI : I2S Tx FIFO trigger level interrupt
00248  *     @arg I2S_INT_TXFIFO_UF  : I2S Rx FIFO underflow interrupt
00249  *     @arg I2S_INT_TXFIFO_OV  : I2S Tx FIFO overflow interrupt
00250  *     @arg I2S_INT_RXFIFO_TRI : I2S Rx FIFO trigger level interrupt
00251  *     @arg I2S_INT_RXFIFO_UV  : I2S Rx FIFO underflow interrupt
00252  *     @arg I2S_INT_RXFIFO_OV  : I2S Rx FIFO overflow interrupt
00253  * @param  NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00254  * @retval None
00255  ************************************************************************************************************/
00256 void I2S_IntConfig(u32 I2S_Int, ControlStatus NewState)
00257 {
00258   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00259   Assert_Param(IS_I2S_INT(I2S_Int));
00260   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00261 
00262   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00263   {
00264     HT_I2S->IER |= I2S_Int;
00265   }
00266   else
00267   {
00268     HT_I2S->IER &= ~I2S_Int;
00269   }
00270 }
00271 
00272 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00273  * @brief  Check whether the specified I2S flag has been set or not.
00274  * @param  I2S_Flag: specify the flag that is to be check.
00275  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00276  *     @arg I2S_FLAG_TXFIFO_TRI : I2S Tx FIFO trigger level flag
00277  *     @arg I2S_FLAG_TXFIFO_UDF : I2S Tx FIFO underflow flag
00278  *     @arg I2S_FLAG_TXFIFO_OVF : I2S Tx FIFO overflow flag
00279  *     @arg I2S_FLAG_TXFIFO_EMP : I2S Tx FIFO empty flag
00280  *     @arg I2S_FLAG_TXFIFO_FUL : I2S Tx FIFO full flag
00281  *     @arg I2S_FLAG_RXFIFO_TRI : I2S Rx FIFO trigger level flag
00282  *     @arg I2S_FLAG_RXFIFO_UDF : I2S Rx FIFO underflow flag
00283  *     @arg I2S_FLAG_RXFIFO_OVF : I2S Rx FIFO overflow flag
00284  *     @arg I2S_FLAG_RXFIFO_EMP : I2S Rx FIFO empty flag
00285  *     @arg I2S_FLAG_RXFIFO_FUL : I2S Rx FIFO full flag
00286  *     @arg I2S_FLAG_RIGHT_CH   : I2S right channel flag
00287  *     @arg I2S_FLAG_TX_BUSY    : I2S Tx busy flag
00288  *     @arg I2S_FLAG_CLK_RDY    : I2S clock ready flag
00289  * @retval SET or RESET
00290  ************************************************************************************************************/
00291 FlagStatus I2S_GetFlagStatus(u32 I2S_Flag)
00292 {
00293   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00294   Assert_Param(IS_I2S_FLAG(I2S_Flag));
00295 
00296   if (HT_I2S->SR & I2S_Flag)
00297   {
00298     return SET;
00299   }
00300   else
00301   {
00302     return RESET;
00303   }
00304 }
00305 
00306 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00307  * @brief  Clear the specified I2S flag.
00308  * @param  I2S_Flag: specify the flag that is to be cleared.
00309  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00310  *     @arg I2S_FLAG_TXFIFO_TRI : I2S Tx FIFO trigger level flag
00311  *     @arg I2S_FLAG_TXFIFO_UV  : I2S Tx FIFO underflow flag
00312  *     @arg I2S_FLAG_TXFIFO_OV  : I2S Tx FIFO overflow flag
00313  *     @arg I2S_FLAG_RXFIFO_TRI : I2S Rx FIFO trigger level flag
00314  *     @arg I2S_FLAG_RXFIFO_UV  : I2S Rx FIFO underflow flag
00315  *     @arg I2S_FLAG_RXFIFO_OV  : I2S Rx FIFO overflow flag
00316  * @retval None
00317  ************************************************************************************************************/
00318 void I2S_ClearFlag(u32 I2S_Flag)
00319 {
00320   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00321   Assert_Param(IS_I2S_FLAG_CLEAR(I2S_Flag));
00322 
00323   HT_I2S->SR = I2S_Flag;
00324 }
